result.markdown:
# Core workforce spectrum {#sec-spectrum-work} ::: {.cell} ::: This chapter assesses the housing spectrum for the region's *core workforce*. This includes all households where at least one member is employed at a job also located within the region. ::: {.callout-tip} ### Defining the "core workforce" For every record of an employed person, the Public Use Microdata Sample (PUMS) includes a variable for the place-of-work Public Use Microdata Area ("POWPUMA"). Households with at least one person who has worked in the last 12 months *and* whose POWPUMA values correspond to the Fredericksburg area (Planning District 16) were designated as members of the core workforce. ::: ## Overview ### Identifying the core workforce Overall commuting trends --- 2/3 of all workers are in core workforce ::: {.cell layout-align="left"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Place of work for job holders who live in region](spectrum-work_files/figure-html/fig-pow-jobs-1.png){#fig-pow-jobs fig-align='left' width=100%} ::: ::: When sorted into their respective households --- most households are part of core workforce (79,545, 60.2%) ::: {.cell layout-align="left"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Households in the core workforce](spectrum-work_files/figure-html/fig-wf-hh-1.png){#fig-wf-hh fig-align='left' width=100%} ::: ::: ### Common industries and occupations Most workers employed at private for-profit businesses in the region ::: {.cell layout-align="left"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Class of workers in core workforce](spectrum-work_files/figure-html/fig-wkr-class-1.png){#fig-wkr-class fig-align='left' width=100%} ::: ::: Most common industries where core workforce is employed ::: {#tbl-wf-ind .cell layout-align="left" tbl-cap='Top five most common core workforce industry groups'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Industry group Workers Percent
Retail and Wholesale 18,481 15%
Professional Services 18,353 15%
Healthcare and Social Assistance 16,261 13%
Public Administration and Military 15,594 12%
Education 12,278 10%
````` ::: ::: Most common job types of core workforce --- across all industries ::: {#tbl-wf-occ .cell layout-align="left" tbl-cap='Top five most common core workforce occupational groups'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Occupational group Workers Percent
Administrative and Clerical Support 14,226 11%
Leadership and Management 13,711 11%
Sales, Marketing, and Customer Service 12,655 10%
Healthcare and Medical Services 10,343 8%
Transportation and Logistics 9,176 7%
````` ::: ::: ### Income Core workforce households more likely to have incomes above 120% AMI, otherwise distribution is similar to households whose workers all have jobs outside of the region ::: {.cell layout-align="left"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Households by workforce status and AMI](spectrum-work_files/figure-html/fig-wf-ami-1.png){#fig-wf-ami fig-align='left' width=100%} ::: ::: ### Household characteristics Most households in core workforce are headed by couples who both hold jobs in the region ::: {#tbl-wf-hh-type .cell layout-align="left" tbl-cap='Five most common core workforce household types'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Household type Children Earners Percent
Couple Yes Two 23%
Couple No Two 20%
Individual No One 12%
Couple Yes One 8%
Couple No One 8%
````` ::: ::: ### Affordability ... ::: {.cell layout-align="left"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Housing costs by workforce status and AMI](spectrum-work_files/figure-html/fig-wf-costs-1.png){#fig-wf-costs fig-align='left' width=100%} ::: ::: ... ::: {.cell layout-align="left"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Housing affordability for core workforce by AMI](spectrum-work_files/figure-html/fig-wf-cb-1.png){#fig-wf-cb fig-align='left' width=100%} ::: ::: ::: {.cell layout-align="left"} ::: ## Below 30% AMI ... ::: {#tbl-below-30 .cell layout-align="left" tbl-cap='Three most common core workforce household types below 30% AMI'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Household type Children Earners Percent
Individual No One 21%
Single parent Yes One 17%
Couple Yes One 17%
````` ::: ::: ... ::: {#tbl-below-30-occ .cell layout-align="left" tbl-cap='Ten most common core workforce occupations below 30% AMI'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Ten Most Common Occupations
1. Customer Service Representatives 6. Nursing Assistants
2. Cooks 7. Maids And Housekeeping Cleaners
3. Cashiers 8. Laborers And Freight, Stock, And Material Movers, Hand
4. First-Line Supervisors Of Retail Sales Workers 9. Sales And Related Workers, All Other
5. Driver/Sales Workers And Truck Drivers 10. Retail Salespersons
````` ::: ::: ## 30-50% AMI ... ::: {#tbl-30-50 .cell layout-align="left" tbl-cap='Three most common core workforce household types between 30-50% AMI'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Household type Children Earners Percent
Individual No One 19%
Couple Yes One 15%
Single parent Yes One 13%
````` ::: ::: ... ::: {#tbl-30-50-occ .cell layout-align="left" tbl-cap='Ten most common core workforce occupations between 30-50% AMI'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Ten Most Common Occupations
1. Construction Laborers 6. Retail Salespersons
2. Cooks 7. First-Line Supervisors Of Retail Sales Workers
3. Driver/Sales Workers And Truck Drivers 8. Stockers And Order Fillers
4. Cashiers 9. Other Managers
5. Janitors And Building Cleaners 10. Receptionists And Information Clerks
````` ::: ::: ## 50-80% AMI ... ::: {#tbl-50-80 .cell layout-align="left" tbl-cap='Three most common core workforce household types between 50-80% AMI'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Household type Children Earners Percent
Couple Yes Two 25%
Individual No One 16%
Couple No Two 14%
````` ::: ::: ... ::: {#tbl-50-80-occ .cell layout-align="left" tbl-cap='Ten most common core workforce occupations between 50-80% AMI'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Ten Most Common Occupations
1. Driver/Sales Workers And Truck Drivers 6. Stockers And Order Fillers
2. Cashiers 7. Registered Nurses
3. Retail Salespersons 8. Maids And Housekeeping Cleaners
4. First-Line Supervisors Of Retail Sales Workers 9. Laborers And Freight, Stock, And Material Movers, Hand
5. Elementary And Middle School Teachers 10. Customer Service Representatives
````` ::: ::: ## 80-100% AMI ... ::: {#tbl-80-100 .cell layout-align="left" tbl-cap='Three most common core workforce household types between 80-100% AMI'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Household type Children Earners Percent
Couple Yes Two 28%
Couple No Two 18%
Couple Yes One 10%
````` ::: ::: ... ::: {#tbl-80-100-occ .cell layout-align="left" tbl-cap='Ten most common core workforce occupations between 80-100% AMI'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Ten Most Common Occupations
1. Elementary And Middle School Teachers 6. Waiters And Waitresses
2. Retail Salespersons 7. Secretaries And Administrative Assistants, Except Legal, Medical, And Executive
3. Software Developers 8. First-Line Supervisors Of Retail Sales Workers
4. Customer Service Representatives 9. Insurance Sales Agents
5. Other Managers 10. Landscaping And Groundskeeping Workers
````` ::: ::: ## 100-120% AMI ... ::: {#tbl-100-120 .cell layout-align="left" tbl-cap='Three most common core workforce household types between 100-120% AMI'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Household type Children Earners Percent
Couple Yes Two 27%
Couple No Two 18%
Individual No One 9%
````` ::: ::: ... ::: {#tbl-100-120-occ .cell layout-align="left" tbl-cap='Ten most common core workforce occupations between 100-120% AMI'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Ten Most Common Occupations
1. Cashiers 6. Other Managers
2. First-Line Supervisors Of Retail Sales Workers 7. Retail Salespersons
3. Driver/Sales Workers And Truck Drivers 8. Software Developers
4. Laborers And Freight, Stock, And Material Movers, Hand 9. Postal Service Mail Carriers
5. Elementary And Middle School Teachers 10. Teaching Assistants
````` ::: ::: ## Above 120% AMI ... Couples with no children but multiple earners would include adult, working children living with their parents ::: {#tbl-120 .cell layout-align="left" tbl-cap='Three most common core workforce household types above 120% AMI'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Household type Children Earners Percent
Couple No Two 30%
Couple Yes Two 25%
Couple No Multiple 11%
````` ::: ::: ... Inclusion of some lower-wage jobs here (e.g. cashiers) implies many live with a second earner who brings in relatively more income ::: {#tbl-120-occ .cell layout-align="left" tbl-cap='Ten most common core workforce occupations above 120% AMI'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Ten Most Common Occupations
1. Other Managers 6. Retail Salespersons
2. Elementary And Middle School Teachers 7. Secretaries And Administrative Assistants, Except Legal, Medical, And Executive
3. Software Developers 8. Cashiers
4. First-Line Supervisors Of Retail Sales Workers 9. Financial Managers
5. Registered Nurses 10. Driver/Sales Workers And Truck Drivers
````` ::: :::
